intro: Canscora petelotii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the cooler months. Canscora petelotii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
